title: Euro
content:
What is the typeface used for Euro?  
 Maybe Frutiger?
author: titi

comments.content: I believe the EU put together [their own specifications](http://web.archive.org/web/20111231071112/http:/www.euro.gouv.fr/pratique/symbole.htm) for a logotype for the [Euro](http://web.archive.org/web/20111231071112/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Euro) symbol.

The Euro symbol is an abomination which shouldn't be used "as is" in text setting -- actually in _any_ setting. Use the euro symbol provided with the typeface you are using.

The dreadful official Euro symbol can be found in [Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20111231071112/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adobe)'s Euro Sans Regular which you can [download for free](http://web.archive.org/web/20111231071112/http:/store.adobe.com/support/downloads/product.jsp?product=48&platform=Macintosh).

\> shouldn’t be used “as is” in text setting

Except maybe if you're using Avant Garde.  
Which I guess you shouldn't anyway though.

hhp
I'm designing a sans at the moment, kind of geometric, and shocked myself by actually using the Euro template, exactly, for creating the symbol in the regular weight.

I am sorry, but I would like to know the name of the font used for the 'Euro' bank-note. Not informations about the 'Euro' logo.  
Maybe that the typeface used in 'Euro' bank-notes is Frutiger? Or?
I found a 10 euro note in the street, just ten minutes ago and it sure looks like Frutiger!
